title: American_Top_40_March_1st,_1980
description:
American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This rebroadcast is one of many I have recorded from internet radio. Some are incomplete but most are not and I hope you enjoy these as much as I do.
In this broadcast:

One song secretly has the Eagles as backup singers.
The highest debuting song is by new-comer Christopher Cross.
Casey answers the question, "Has any album ever debuted at number one on the album chart?"
One singer/songwriter in the countdown was turned down by Motown in his first 100 songwriting submissions, just to have his 101st become their 1st top ten hit.
